section.name: Get Involved
section.p: To contact the EJBCA team or to contribute, use the mailing lists, irc or contact the project administrator, who can be found on the sourceforge project page.

subsection.name: Development tools

ul.li: An operating system that can run Java (Linux, OSX, Windows..). Most developers use Ubuntu/Debian.
Eclipse JEE edition with an additional Subversion (SVN) plugin installed.
OpenJDK 6, or OracleJDK 6 (for the EJBCA 4.x-branch only supports JDK 6)
Apache Ant 1.7.x (with all the extras that comes with the zip from apache.org or 'ant-optional' Ubuntu package)
A supported application server (JBoss AS 5.1.0.GA, 6.0.0 etc)
A favourite database supported by EJBCA that is easy to work with (Hypersonic, MySQL, PostgreSQL.).
A virtualization solution for testing additional combinations of application servers and databases and external OCSP responders etc.

subsection.p: Changes that affect the database requires more databases to test with, changes that affect the EJBs or setup requires additional application servers etc.. What you need to know to develop EJBCA

ul.li: The tools described in the previous section
Public Key Infrastructure and related technologies
J2EE and JEE5
Enterprise JavaBeans (excluding message passing)
Java Persistence API
Java ServerPages and Java ServerFaces
Web Services
Databases

subsection.name: Sending patches
subsection.p: If you are not a comitter in SVN we are glad to accept patches. You can send us patches either in diff format (svn diff) or created with Eclipse. You can also send us you complete files that you changed, we can see the diffs in Eclipse.
Please follow these simple guidelines when submitting patches:

Keep the patch limited, only change the parts related to your patch. Do not change other lines, such as whitespace, adding line breaks to java doc etc. It will make it very very hard for us to review the patch.

subsection.name: Using SVN
subsection.p: How to connect to the EJBCA svn repository is explained over at repository. If you are using Eclipse we recommend the Subversive plug-in, now part of eclipse plug-in repositories.

section.name: Contributors
section.p: We encourage and appreciate all contributions. Here is the list of all people who have donated their valuable time to produce code included in EJBCA. Many others have contributed with bug reports, feature suggestions etc etc.

ul.li: Tomas Gustavsson, Project founder.
Philip Vendil, Core developer until 2008.
Anna Diruba Christensen, First project homepage design, until EJBCA 3.5.
Nathan Phelps, Testing, bugfinding and suggestions.
Leo Tai, Oracle database configuration.
Timothy Fisher, Architecture overview.
Karl-König Königsson, Better deployment scripts for EJBCA 2.x.

Slava Sklarewski, Data flow diagram.
Leonardo Souza Mario Bueno, Patch for request template path.

Lars Silven, Core developer.
Gösta Bäckström, Initial PKCS7 to browsers.
Ville Skyttä, AdminCertReqServlet, Various patches, LDAP publisher advice

Manuel Ruiz, Make admin commands flexible and usable from within java-code.

Philipp Faerber, EJBCA 3.0.x on Weblogic 8.1, adminweb sql fix. Initial support for Eracom HSM. German translation.

Alejandro Falcone, Spanish translation.
